info:
Desktop MP3 music player and download station for Bacardi Breezer.
Music supplied in association with clickmusic.com.
Tracks could be streamed and downloaded from several managed lists that would be updated on a regular basis.
The player was created in Macromedia Director and was distributed as an installable application.
The design had an irregular shape and had an expanded and collasped state.

Promotional site for nokia phones whilst sponsoring the factor talent show.
Very early adoption of flash video capability.
Early example of a drag and drop interface (choose your factor).
And a pie throwing game... what more do you want.

Promotional site for the launch of the action film.
Side scrolling animated interactive navigation, leading to snippets of information.

Promotional site for nokia phones whilst sponsoring London Fashion week.
Nice example of a side scrolling feature graphic navigation.
The content is overlaid with a peak-through window to the feature graphic.

Product and corporate information site.
Note that the site is fixed size with no scrolling, larger amounts of content obviously being paginated.

Nokia does speed dating... well animal antic events for students at least.
A bit of an oldie now but the design is still lovely and it features a spank the monkey game!

Experience site for the 118118 information service.
The site featured the latest TV adverts, a feed of live questions and answers, the ability to search for an answer.

For the launch of Gillette fusion power razor.
The site was based around a game where you need to be a crack shot to hit the button on the razor.

Nokia ran multiple Rock up and Play events around the UK.
This website used streaming video for instant playback, and contained clips recorded from the events and User Generated Content where musicians uploaded videos of themselves.
There where several searchable music genre sections (stages), and songs could be rated and shared.
The site also had information and blogs for the festivals, competitions, Nokia product and band feature pages.

Website promoting the DVD releases of all the Star trek franchise as they were released over several years.
The site also included competitions, video clips, quizzes, interactive features, news, and cast interviews.

E-Commerce website where visitors could customise the design on the front of a box of Ashbury's chocolates.
Users could customise a template design or simply use an uploaded image as the entire design.

Long living site which was very frequently updated with new content.
Predominately based around Gillette sport sponsorships, but also featured other promotions and featurettes.
The main design revolved around 4 exploratory environments where the content would be linked via an item therein, new items were added for every new section of content.
The site also had a more recognisable navigation device to ensure visitors weren’t lost looking for something.

Product interface emulators for Electroluminescent display developer Pelikon.
These were used to illustrate how a product either speculative or in development might look should it go into production.

Promotional site to coincide with Grant's updated glass bottle designs.
Each page in the site has a vignette treatment to reflect the heritage, experience and flavours of Grants.
Modular site structure whereby an application loads separate components and pages at run time, each page therefore has a configured technical template though itself being creatively unique.
All text is held in XML to allow for translations to Russian, French, Portuguese, Spanish and Greek

Visitors enter a code from an on packet promotion.
They are then transported to 1 of 20 random locations to find a prize.
Each code could only be used once with the win/lose outcome determined by a database of draw codes.
Returning visitors would not see the same location until all had been viewed.
Adaptation of a CAPTCHA code library for use in flash player.
Multiple choice quiz for ROI route as legally they require an element of skill.

Rather than read lots of information at once the site takes the form of a decision tree.
Visitors read a short passage then progress by making a simple choice, meaning they only read what is relevant to them.
Each line connecting the text windows is drawn according to x,y co-ordinates, this information is then also used to create the animated transitions.
The 'find a financial advisor' window connected to a web service that returned registered advisor details by they're proximity to a given postcode.

Rather than claim an ‘up to’ top speed, be* broadband's headline was it was 'more than' the regular speed at the time of 8Mb/s.
Connected to a web service that given a landline number would returned the lines length which was then used to calculate the speed likely to be achieved.
If you had under 8Mb you would go to broadband hell, but more than sends you to broadband heaven.
The line checker service was closely guarded and as such required that the access to it in the site code was encrypted and obfuscated.

An internal education site that was architected to divide a large amount of information into bitesize chunks.
All sections are animated between for a more interactive and engaging experience.
Animation had to be snappy enough so as not to degrade response time between click and read by too much.
A section sitemap is also included as an even quicker way of jumping between sections.

A video decision tree game made from 43 interlinking clips.
To help create a more seamless experience the site uses a form of 'smart loading'. As you are watching a clip the next 2 (right & wrong decision) load to cache in the background so they are ready to play without buffering.
Whilst this does create slightly more net traffic than necessary, it was at the time significantly cheaper than a streaming server setup.
The site was also translated for German, Spanish, French, Italian and Dutch markets.

Argos world cup promotion where visitors are given the chance to win the contents of an argos world truck.
Short series of interlinked interactive video clips.
Particularly nice integration of the win form to the video.

Promotional and informative site for Marabou Premium Chocolate drawing attention to their affiliation with the Rainforest Alliance.
Launched in Swedish and Danish variations.
Undertook all aspects of development (HTML, CSS, Javascript, Flash, XML, PHP, mySQL)

Mobile app and online version for medical professionals to quickly work out optimal dose and dilution of the drug.
The weight sliders are of particular technical interest as they required some pretty trick scripting to create the effect moving around the point of the indicator.

Web based app to show how broadcasters can choose to render a news story different ways.
Users can flip between clips of reporters presenting the same story, over a choice of green screen background locations.

Touch table drag and drop card match game installed at medical conferences.
Who knew scientist where such a competitive bunch... feedback from the events said the scoreboard mechanic made this so popular it had queues of people wanting to play to get top ranking.
The game appeared in slightly different guises for 3 years.

I have worked on several campaigns for Cisco.
They have required standard and Rich media Flash, basic and automated HTML builds and are frequently translated to several languages.
Campaign to advertise the Helluva Tour TV program sponsored by Fosters.

I have worked on approx. 20 Halifax campaigns.
After the initial build of each campaign the setup would be part automated using node and grunt to help manage the number of variations.
The Hanna Barbara cartoon character were created as sprite sheets per size variation and animated via javascript.

I have worked on approx. 30 John Lewis campaigns.
Whilst all followed a brand style guide/ template each campaign creative and build was bespoke.

The Lloyds bank banners were developed with an automation process.
It used node and grunt to iterate over a template setup and exported approx. 60 banner variations.
The automation code was used over many campaigns.

I have worked on a few campaigns for Oakley, some using Flash and some like this one using HTML.
This creative uses HTML canvas gradients and a blur plugin to create the transition between frames.

I have worked on several campaigns for Virgin which on the whole followed the same base creative template(s).
The legal info was a dynamic feed so changes could be made to all banners in a campaign last minute or even after live.

This campaign for Volkswagen commercial vehicles ran during the UEFA European cup football tournament.
The graphic seen here as a cake was managed via a dynamic feed and could have shown as either an English, Irish or Welsh flag depending on:

- The user’s geolocation.
- If that nation was still in the running.

So if a viewer was at a location where the nation team was no longer in the tournament they would see a cake instead of the relevant flag.

Enter the site by zooming into the SEAT Geneva Motor show stand.
Here we have 3d views of each car, photos, videos and reviews.
The site also hosted a live video feed of the motor show event and integration to the SEAT team twitter feed.

Promotional site for the launch of SEAT SC
Interior and exterior 3D views of the SEAT Leon SC pointing out key features.
Each feature leads to page for more information, of which 5 are bespoke interactive pages.
Web site frontend development using atomic design pattern library and build system, incorporating handlebars, SCSS, and standards-based JavaScript.

JavaScript heavy development creating complex pages including decision based dynamic forms, charts and user configurable content.  Incorporating runtime template rendering via RivetsJs and Redux to further support Single Page Applications.
Atomic design pattern library of UI components, form page layouts and React demo
